breakfast.title: Spiced Chickpea Flour Pancakes with Mediterranean Vegetables
breakfast.description: Protein-rich gluten-free pancakes made with chickpea flour, topped with grilled Mediterranean vegetables and a spicy yogurt sauce
breakfast.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Prepare the batter**: Mix chickpea flour, water, turmeric, cumin, chili powder, and salt in a bowl. Whisk until smooth and let rest for 10 minutes.

2. **Prepare vegetables**: Dice bell pepper, zucchini, and red onion. Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a pan and sauté vegetables until tender and slightly charred, about 5-7 minutes.

3. **Make spiced yogurt**: Mix Greek yogurt with paprika and a pinch of salt.

4. **Cook pancakes**: Heat remaining olive oil in a non-stick pan. Pour batter to make 3 medium pancakes. Cook 2-3 minutes per side until golden.

5. **Serve**: Top pancakes with grilled vegetables, spiced yogurt, and fresh cilantro.

lunch.title: Thai-Spiced Quinoa Bowl with Grilled Halloumi
lunch.description: A vibrant quinoa bowl with Thai-inspired flavors, featuring grilled halloumi cheese, fresh vegetables, and a spicy lime dressing
lunch.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Cook quinoa**: Rinse quinoa and cook in vegetable broth according to package directions. Let cool slightly.

2. **Prepare vegetables**: Dice cucumber, halve cherry tomatoes, and shred red cabbage. Cook edamame according to package directions.

3. **Make dressing**: Whisk together lime juice, sesame oil, sriracha, minced ginger, and minced garlic.

4. **Grill halloumi**: Heat a grill pan or skillet over medium-high heat. Slice halloumi and grill 2-3 minutes per side until golden.

5. **Assemble bowl**: Combine quinoa with half the dressing. Top with vegetables, edamame, and grilled halloumi. Drizzle with remaining dressing and garnish with fresh herbs.

dinner.title: Indian Spiced Eggplant Parmesan with Herb-Crusted Sweet Potato
dinner.description: A fusion dish combining Italian eggplant parmesan with Indian spices, served alongside herb-crusted roasted sweet potatoes
dinner.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Preheat oven**: Heat to 400°F (200°C).

2. **Prepare sweet potatoes**: Cube sweet potatoes and toss with 1 tbsp olive oil, rosemary, thyme, salt, and pepper. Roast for 25-30 minutes.

3. **Prepare eggplant**: Slice eggplant into 0.5-inch rounds. Salt and let drain for 15 minutes, then pat dry.

4. **Make spiced coating**: Mix breadcrumbs with garam masala, coriander powder, and cayenne pepper.

5. **Bread eggplant**: Beat eggs in one dish. Dip eggplant slices in egg, then coat with spiced breadcrumbs.

6. **Cook eggplant**: Heat remaining olive oil in a large oven-safe skillet. Brown eggplant slices 3-4 minutes per side.

7. **Assemble and bake**: Layer marinara sauce over eggplant, top with mozzarella and parmesan. Bake 20 minutes until bubbly.

8. **Serve**: Plate eggplant parmesan with herb-crusted sweet potatoes.

breakfast.title: Spicy Indian Chickpea Flour Pancakes (Besan Chilla)
breakfast.description: Protein-rich savory pancakes with Indian spices and vegetables
breakfast.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Mix the batter**: In a bowl, combine chickpea flour, turmeric, cumin, chili powder, and salt. Gradually add water while whisking to avoid lumps.

2. **Add vegetables**: Fold in diced tomatoes, bell peppers, and cilantro. Let batter rest for 5 minutes.

3. **Cook pancakes**: Heat 1 tbsp oil in a non-stick pan. Pour half the batter and spread evenly. Cook for 3-4 minutes until golden.

4. **Flip and finish**: Flip carefully and cook another 2-3 minutes. Repeat with remaining batter.

5. **Serve**: Cut into wedges and serve hot with toasted gluten-free bread.

lunch.title: Mediterranean Grilled Vegetable Quinoa Bowl
lunch.description: Grilled vegetables over quinoa with spicy tahini dressing
lunch.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Cook quinoa**: Rinse quinoa and cook in vegetable broth for 15 minutes until fluffy. Set aside.

2. **Prepare vegetables**: Slice zucchini, eggplant, and bell pepper into thick strips. Brush with 2 tbsp olive oil and season with salt.

3. **Grill vegetables**: Heat grill pan over medium-high heat. Grill vegetables for 4-5 minutes per side until charred and tender.

4. **Make dressing**: Whisk tahini, lemon juice, remaining olive oil, minced garlic, paprika, and cayenne with 2-3 tbsp water.

5. **Assemble bowl**: Layer quinoa, grilled vegetables, chickpeas, and crumbled feta. Drizzle with spicy tahini dressing.

dinner.title: Thai-Italian Fusion Spicy Eggplant Curry with Rice
dinner.description: Creamy coconut curry with eggplant, Italian herbs, and jasmine rice
dinner.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Cook rice**: Rinse jasmine rice and cook in 1.5 cups water for 18 minutes. Let stand 5 minutes, then fluff.

2. **Prepare ingredients**: Cube eggplant and tofu. Halve cherry tomatoes. Tear mozzarella into chunks.

3. **Cook eggplant**: Heat coconut oil in large pan. Sauté eggplant cubes for 8-10 minutes until golden and tender.

4. **Make curry**: Add curry paste and cook 1 minute. Pour in coconut milk, soy sauce, brown sugar, and chili flakes. Simmer 5 minutes.

5. **Add proteins**: Add cubed tofu and cherry tomatoes. Cook 3-4 minutes. Stir in mozzarella chunks until melted.

6. **Finish and serve**: Remove from heat, add lime juice and both basils. Serve over jasmine rice.

breakfast.title: Spiced Indian Chickpea Flour Pancakes (Besan Chilla)
breakfast.description: Savory gluten-free pancakes made with chickpea flour, vegetables, and aromatic Indian spices
breakfast.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Prepare the batter**: In a bowl, whisk chickpea flour with water until smooth. Let rest for 10 minutes.

2. **Add vegetables and spices**: Finely chop bell pepper, onion, cilantro, and green chili. Mix into batter with turmeric, cumin, chili powder, and salt.

3. **Cook the pancakes**: Heat 1 tbsp oil in a non-stick pan. Pour half the batter, spread thinly. Cook 3-4 minutes until golden.

4. **Flip and finish**: Flip carefully, cook 2-3 minutes more. Repeat with remaining batter.

5. **Serve**: Cut into wedges and serve hot with Greek yogurt on the side.

lunch.title: Mediterranean Grilled Vegetable and Quinoa Bowl
lunch.description: A vibrant bowl with grilled vegetables, fluffy quinoa, and tangy Mediterranean flavors
lunch.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Cook quinoa**: Rinse quinoa and cook in vegetable broth for 15 minutes until fluffy. Set aside.

2. **Prep vegetables**: Cut zucchini, bell pepper, eggplant, and onion into thick slices. Halve cherry tomatoes.

3. **Make marinade**: Mix 2 tbsp olive oil, minced garlic, oregano, paprika, salt and pepper.

4. **Grill vegetables**: Brush vegetables with marinade. Grill on medium-high heat 4-5 minutes per side until charred and tender.

5. **Assemble bowl**: Layer quinoa in bowl, top with grilled vegetables, drained chickpeas, and crumbled feta.

6. **Finish**: Drizzle with remaining olive oil, lemon juice, and fresh torn basil leaves.

dinner.title: Thai-Spiced Grilled Tofu with Coconut Rice and Vegetables
dinner.description: Aromatic Thai-inspired dish with spicy grilled tofu, creamy coconut rice, and fresh vegetables
dinner.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Prepare tofu**: Press tofu to remove excess water, cut into thick slabs. Mix curry paste, 2 tbsp soy sauce, lime juice, and brown sugar. Marinate tofu for 20 minutes.

2. **Cook coconut rice**: Rinse rice until water runs clear. Combine with coconut milk, water, and salt. Bring to boil, then simmer covered for 18 minutes.

3. **Prep vegetables**: Cut broccoli into florets, slice bell pepper, trim snap peas. Mince ginger and garlic.

4. **Grill tofu**: Heat grill pan with vegetable oil. Grill marinated tofu 4-5 minutes per side until nicely charred.

5. **Stir-fry vegetables**: In wok with sesame oil, stir-fry ginger and garlic 30 seconds. Add vegetables, stir-fry 3-4 minutes until crisp-tender. Season with remaining soy sauce.

6. **Serve**: Plate coconut rice, top with grilled tofu and vegetables. Garnish with fresh cilantro and lime wedges.

breakfast.title: Spicy Indian Chickpea Flour Pancakes (Besan Chilla)
breakfast.description: Protein-rich savory pancakes with Indian spices and vegetables
breakfast.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Prepare the batter**: In a mixing bowl, combine chickpea flour, turmeric, cumin powder, red chili powder, and salt.

2. **Add liquid**: Gradually add water while whisking to form a smooth, lump-free batter. Let it rest for 10 minutes.

3. **Add vegetables**: Mix in diced onions, tomatoes, green chili, and cilantro into the batter.

4. **Cook pancakes**: Heat 1 tbsp oil in a non-stick pan. Pour 1/3 of the batter and spread evenly. Cook for 3-4 minutes until golden.

5. **Flip and finish**: Flip carefully and cook for another 2-3 minutes. Repeat for remaining batter.

6. **Serve with oats**: Serve hot pancakes with a side of cooked oats mixed with remaining oil.

lunch.title: Mediterranean Grilled Vegetable and Quinoa Bowl
lunch.description: Smoky grilled vegetables with protein-packed quinoa and tahini dressing
lunch.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Cook quinoa**: Rinse quinoa and cook in 2 cups water until fluffy, about 15 minutes. Set aside.

2. **Prepare vegetables**: Preheat grill or grill pan. Brush vegetables with 2 tbsp olive oil and season with salt, pepper, and oregano.

3. **Grill vegetables**: Grill vegetables for 4-6 minutes per side until tender and charred. Grill chickpeas for 3-4 minutes.

4. **Make dressing**: Whisk together tahini, lemon juice, minced garlic, paprika, remaining olive oil, and 2 tbsp water.

5. **Assemble bowl**: Place quinoa in bowl, top with grilled vegetables and chickpeas.

6. **Finish and serve**: Drizzle with tahini dressing and crumble feta cheese on top.

dinner.title: Thai-Italian Fusion Spicy Tomato Rice with Grilled Paneer
dinner.description: Aromatic jasmine rice in spicy tomato sauce with perfectly grilled paneer
dinner.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Cook rice**: Prepare jasmine rice according to package directions. Set aside.

2. **Marinate paneer**: Toss paneer cubes with 1 tbsp olive oil, half the red pepper flakes, and salt. Let marinate 10 minutes.

3. **Make sauce**: Heat 1 tbsp oil in large pan. Sauté onions until soft, add garlic and ginger for 1 minute.

4. **Add spices**: Stir in curry paste, cook 1 minute. Add crushed tomatoes, coconut milk, soy sauce, and brown sugar.

5. **Simmer**: Let sauce simmer 15 minutes until thickened. Add bell peppers in last 5 minutes.

6. **Grill paneer**: Heat grill pan with remaining oil. Grill paneer cubes until golden on all sides, about 6-8 minutes total.

7. **Combine and serve**: Stir cooked rice into sauce, add lime juice and fresh basil. Top with grilled paneer.

breakfast.title: Spiced Indian Chickpea Pancakes with Coconut Yogurt
breakfast.description: Protein-rich gluten-free pancakes made from chickpea flour with aromatic Indian spices, served with coconut yogurt
breakfast.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Prepare the batter**: In a bowl, whisk chickpea flour with water until smooth. Add turmeric, cumin, coriander, chili powder, and salt.

2. **Add aromatics**: Finely chop cilantro and green chili, mix into batter. Let rest for 5 minutes.

3. **Cook pancakes**: Heat coconut oil in a non-stick pan over medium heat. Pour batter to make 3-4 pancakes, cook 2-3 minutes per side until golden.

4. **Serve**: Stack pancakes and serve warm with coconut yogurt on the side.

5. **Enjoy**: Garnish with extra cilantro if desired.

lunch.title: Mediterranean Grilled Eggplant and Quinoa Bowl
lunch.description: Hearty grilled eggplant with herb-infused quinoa, cherry tomatoes, and tahini dressing
lunch.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Cook quinoa**: Rinse quinoa and cook in vegetable broth for 15 minutes until fluffy. Set aside.

2. **Prepare eggplant**: Slice eggplant into rounds, brush with olive oil, season with salt and pepper.

3. **Grill eggplant**: Heat grill pan over medium-high heat. Grill eggplant 4-5 minutes per side until tender and charred.

4. **Make dressing**: Whisk tahini, lemon juice, minced garlic, and red pepper flakes with 2-3 tbsp water until smooth.

5. **Assemble bowl**: Layer quinoa, grilled eggplant, cherry tomatoes, fresh herbs, and hemp seeds.

6. **Finish**: Drizzle with tahini dressing and serve immediately.

dinner.title: Thai-Spiced Grilled Tofu with Coconut Rice
dinner.description: Marinated tofu with Thai aromatics, served over fragrant coconut jasmine rice with stir-fried vegetables
dinner.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Marinate tofu**: Press and cube tofu. Mix soy sauce, lime juice, curry paste, and minced ginger. Marinate tofu 15 minutes.

2. **Cook rice**: Combine rice, coconut milk, and water in a pot. Bring to boil, reduce heat, simmer 18 minutes until tender.

3. **Grill tofu**: Heat grill pan with coconut oil. Grill marinated tofu 3-4 minutes per side until golden and slightly charred.

4. **Stir-fry vegetables**: In the same pan, stir-fry bell peppers and snap peas with garlic for 3-4 minutes until crisp-tender.

5. **Combine**: Add grilled tofu back to pan with vegetables, toss with Thai basil and sesame oil.

6. **Serve**: Plate coconut rice topped with Thai-spiced tofu and vegetables. Garnish with extra Thai basil.

breakfast.title: Spiced Chickpea Flour Pancakes with Grilled Vegetables
breakfast.description: Protein-rich Indian-style savory pancakes with turmeric and spices, served with grilled bell peppers and tomatoes
breakfast.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Prepare batter**: Mix chickpea flour, turmeric, cumin, chili powder, and salt in a bowl. Gradually add water to make a smooth batter.

2. **Prep vegetables**: Cut bell peppers and tomatoes into thick slices. Brush with 1 tbsp olive oil and season with salt.

3. **Grill vegetables**: Heat grill pan over medium heat. Grill vegetables for 3-4 minutes per side until charred.

4. **Cook pancakes**: Heat remaining oil in non-stick pan. Pour batter to make 3-4 pancakes. Cook 2-3 minutes per side until golden.

5. **Serve**: Top pancakes with grilled vegetables and fresh cilantro.

lunch.title: Mediterranean Grilled Halloumi with Spicy Rice Pilaf
lunch.description: Grilled halloumi cheese with aromatic basmati rice cooked with Mediterranean herbs and spices
lunch.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Prepare rice**: Heat 2 tbsp oil in a pot. Sauté diced onion and garlic until fragrant. Add rice and toast for 2 minutes.

2. **Cook pilaf**: Add broth, tomatoes, paprika, oregano, and red pepper flakes. Bring to boil, reduce heat, cover and simmer 18 minutes.

3. **Prep halloumi**: Slice halloumi into 1/2 inch thick pieces. Pat dry with paper towels.

4. **Grill cheese**: Heat grill pan over medium-high heat. Brush halloumi with remaining oil. Grill 2-3 minutes per side until golden.

5. **Serve**: Fluff rice with fork, stir in parsley. Serve with grilled halloumi on top.

dinner.title: Thai-Spiced Grilled Paneer with Italian Herb Quinoa
dinner.description: Marinated paneer with Thai spices, grilled and served over herb-infused quinoa with Mediterranean flavors
dinner.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Marinate paneer**: Cut paneer into cubes. Mix coconut milk, lime juice, soy sauce, and curry paste. Marinate paneer for 20 minutes.

2. **Cook quinoa**: Rinse quinoa. Heat 1 tbsp oil in pot, add quinoa and toast 2 minutes. Add broth, bring to boil, reduce heat and simmer covered 15 minutes.

3. **Prep vegetables**: Dice zucchini and mince garlic. Chop sun-dried tomatoes and basil.

4. **Grill paneer**: Heat grill pan over medium-high heat. Grill marinated paneer 3-4 minutes per side until golden.

5. **Finish quinoa**: Heat remaining oil, sauté garlic and zucchini 3 minutes. Stir into cooked quinoa with tomatoes and basil.

6. **Serve**: Top herbed quinoa with grilled paneer and fresh basil leaves.

breakfast.title: Spiced Chickpea Flour Pancakes with Greek Yogurt
breakfast.description: Protein-rich Indian-style besan chilla with Mediterranean yogurt and fresh herbs
breakfast.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Prepare batter**: Mix chickpea flour, turmeric, red chili powder, and cumin seeds in a bowl
2. **Add vegetables**: Finely chop onion and bell pepper, add to flour mixture
3. **Make batter**: Gradually add water to form a smooth, pourable batter
4. **Cook pancakes**: Heat olive oil in non-stick pan, pour batter to make 2-3 pancakes, cook 3-4 minutes each side
5. **Prepare yogurt**: Mix Greek yogurt with honey and chopped cilantro
6. **Serve**: Top warm pancakes with spiced yogurt mixture

lunch.title: Mediterranean Quinoa Bowl with Grilled Vegetables
lunch.description: Hearty quinoa bowl with grilled Mediterranean vegetables, feta cheese, and tahini dressing
lunch.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Cook quinoa**: Rinse quinoa, cook in 200ml boiling water for 15 minutes until fluffy
2. **Prepare vegetables**: Slice zucchini, eggplant, and bell pepper into strips
3. **Season vegetables**: Toss with olive oil, oregano, paprika, salt and pepper
4. **Grill vegetables**: Cook on grill pan for 8-10 minutes until tender and charred
5. **Make dressing**: Whisk tahini with lemon juice and 2 tbsp water
6. **Assemble bowl**: Layer quinoa, grilled vegetables, crumbled feta, cherry tomatoes
7. **Finish**: Drizzle with tahini dressing and garnish with fresh parsley

dinner.title: Thai-Spiced Grilled Tofu with Coconut Rice
dinner.description: Marinated grilled tofu with aromatic coconut jasmine rice and Thai herbs
dinner.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Marinate tofu**: Press tofu, slice thick. Mix curry paste, soy sauce, lime juice, minced garlic, ginger, and brown sugar. Marinate tofu 20 minutes
2. **Cook rice**: Rinse jasmine rice, cook with half coconut milk and water (1:1.5 ratio) for 18 minutes
3. **Prepare herbs**: Roughly chop Thai basil and cilantro
4. **Grill tofu**: Heat grill pan with vegetable oil, grill marinated tofu 4-5 minutes each side until golden
5. **Finish rice**: Stir remaining coconut milk and sesame oil into cooked rice
6. **Serve**: Plate coconut rice, top with grilled tofu, garnish with fresh herbs
7. **Final touch**: Drizzle any remaining marinade over the dish
